# Constitutional Council (Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic)

| type = President of the Constitutional Council and 2 members are appointed by the President of the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic, 2 members by the Sahrawi National Council, 2 members by the Supreme Council of Justice
| jurisdiction = Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic
| chiefjudgetitle = President of the Constitutional Council
| chiefjudgename = Mohamed Bouzid Mezine
| termstart = 10 August 2023
}}
The Constitutional Council () is a judicial body in the government of the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic. It is composed of six members and a president, each two are appointed by the Sahrawi National Council, the Supreme Council of Justice, and the President of the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic, the latter of whom appoints the president of the council.

Members of the Constitutional Council are granted immunity while performing their duties and cannot face prosecution or arrest except in the event of a severe criminal offense. Their immunity is lifted through an explicit request from the Minister of Justice, approved by the president of the council. In the case of the president, the consent of the President of the Republic is required.
See also
* Supreme Court of the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic
